title.value: Cone-Traced Supersampling for Signed Distance Field Rendering
title.justification: The exact title of the paper is stated at the beginning.
title.quote: Cone-Traced Supersampling for Signed Distance Field Rendering

extractions.description: The paper introduces Cone-Traced SuperSampling (CTSS), an efficient spatial antialiasing technique that complements the sphere tracing algorithm for Signed Distance Field (SDF) rendering. CTSS reduces computational overhead while providing high-quality antialiasing comparable to 4x-8x supersampling.

type.justification: The paper provides empirical results comparing CTSS to other antialiasing methods in terms of visual quality and performance.
type.quote: We provide empirical results in Sect. 4, comparing CTSS to other available antialiasing solutions for SDF rendering in terms of visual quality and performance.

name.justification: The paper focuses on improving antialiasing techniques for rendering Signed Distance Fields using computer graphics methods.
name.quote: Index Terms: Computing methodologies—Computer graphics—Image manipulation—Antialiasing; Computing methodologies—Computer graphics—Shape modeling—Parametric curve and surface models; Computing methodologies—Computer graphics—Rendering—Ray tracing

name.justification: The paper mentions using Shadertoy for implementing sphere tracing with and without CTSS.
name.quote: All our tests were performed on a Windows 10 machine with an Intel® Core™ i7-11900K CPU and NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3090 GPU. We implemented sphere tracing with and without CTSS in Shadertoy

referenced_paper_title.value: Shadertoy: Live coding for reactive shaders
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references Shadertoy and provides a link to the Shadertoy website.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Interactive CTSS demo and code on Shadertoy: https://www.shadertoy.com/view/7lSXWK

name.justification: The paper mentions using Unity Engine for implementing sphere tracing with and without CTSS for performance evaluations.
name.quote: We implemented sphere tracing with and without CTSS in Shadertoy1 [25] (GLSL) for exploration and in Unity Engine [48] (HLSL) for performance evaluations.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references Unity Engine and provides a citation for it.
